keyword: how many calories in a chicken caesar salad
title: How Many Calories in a Chicken Caesar Salad?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a chicken caesar salad, including full nutrition breakdown with protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for lighter versions.
h1: How Many Calories in a Chicken Caesar Salad?
assumptions: Standard restaurant-style serving: romaine lettuce, 100g grilled chicken breast, parmesan cheese, croutons, and caesar dressing; approx. 350g total weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, portion size, dressing amount, and ingredients; homemade versions differ. Check menus or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard chicken caesar salad has about 550 kcal, with 35g protein and 35g fat mostly from dressing.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a chicken caesar salad without dressing?
faqs.a: About 300-350 kcal, saving ~200-250 from full dressing.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a chicken caesar salad?
faqs.a: Typically 35g from the grilled chicken, making it a solid meal option.

faqs.q: Are chicken caesar salads high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1200mg per serving, mainly from dressing and cheese.

faqs.q: How to make a low-calorie chicken caesar salad?
faqs.a: Use light dressing, skip croutons, and opt for more veggies to drop under 400 kcal.

faqs.q: Calories in homemade vs. restaurant chicken caesar salad?
faqs.a: Homemade can be 300-500 kcal with control over portions; restaurant often 500-700 kcal.
